title: Feature request: Multi-label Binarizer (k-hot)
body_html:
Hi, I feel like an array op that converts between iterable of iterables and a multi-label format would be useful for preprocessing in multi-label tasks. Basically a tensorflow version of a sklearn MultiLabelBinarizer that can iterate through Tensors.
I would assume a tf.one_hot() modification can work.
Thanks.
body_text:
Hi, I feel like an array op that converts between iterable of iterables and a multi-label format would be useful for preprocessing in multi-label tasks. Basically a tensorflow version of a sklearn MultiLabelBinarizer that can iterate through Tensors.
I would assume a tf.one_hot() modification can work.
Thanks.
body:
Hi, I feel like an array op that converts between iterable of iterables and a multi-label format would be useful for preprocessing in multi-label tasks. Basically a tensorflow version of a sklearn [MultiLabelBinarizer](http://scikit-learn.org/stable/modules/generated/sklearn.preprocessing.MultiLabelBinarizer.html) that can iterate through Tensors.
I would assume a `tf.one_hot()` modification can work.
Thanks.
